\dt 04/Mar/2024

\xn

\ge skull

\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf 

\xv kupqhuwq
\xr kup1 ho6
\so phk_kup1ho6
\xe the skull of a head, a person's head regarded as the brain, mind, thought or
intelligence 
\xv kupqhuwqkunq
\xr kup1 ho6 kon2
\so phk_kup1ho6kon2.wav
\xe a human skull
\xv kupqhuwqguwqxj
\xr kup1 ho6 No2 khAi2
\so phk_kup1ho6No2khaai2.wav
\xe the skull of a bull or buffalo 
\xv kupqemaela
\xr kup1 mQ3 lQ3
\so phk_kup1mQ3lQ3.wav
\xe the skull, also, a person's head regarded as the brain, mind, thought or
intelligence
\xv kupqhuwqmaygq
\xr kup1 ho6 ma5 yaN6
\so phk_kup1ho6maa5yaN6
\xe stupid, foolish, brainless, (often derogatory, informal ) 
\xv kupqhuwqmJnqpYkqka
\xr kup1 ho6 mvn2 pyAk4 kA1
\so phk_kup1ho6mvn2pyaak4kaa1.wav
\xe his/her brain has become disorder
\xn

\so phk_NoN2.wav

things

\pd
\pde

\dn
\rf

\xr NoN2 cAN4
\so phk_NoN2caaN4.wav

\xr NoN2 mai4 sAN2
\so phk_NoN2mai4saaN2.wav
\xe a bamboo shoot which grow down wards to the ground
\xv gugqmaAunq
\xr NoN2 ma1 un6
\so phk_NoN2ma1un6.wav
\xe the blossom of the coconut 
\xv emagugq
\xr mq3 NoN2
\so phk_mq3NoN2.wav
\xe a pot having spout or a projecting tube as the kettle having spout
\xv gugqkokq
\xr NoN2 kauk1
\so phk_NoN2kauk1.wav
\xe the handle of a cup

\xr kauk1 NoN2 
\so phk_kauk1NoN2.wav 
\xe a cup with handle
\xv gugqtgqkkq
\xr NoN2 taN1 kAk4
\so phk_NoN2taN1kaak4.wav
\xe the arm of a chair  
\xv gugqvuwq
\xr NoN2 tho1
\so phk_NoN2tho1.wav
\xe the sprout of a bean seed

\xr NoN2 khau3
\so phk_NoN2khau3.wav
\xe the sprout of a rice grain

\lx cokq
\le
\ph cauk1
\so phk_cauk1
\ps n
\de a kind of basket with a tapering bottom and a leather
strap or weave cane strap,  as a handle, usually used by the
hill people. While carrying this basket, its strap is placed on
the forehead and the basket itself is carried on the back
\ge basket
\pc1 1_phk_cauk1.jpg
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv cokqhgq
\xr cauk1 hAN1
\so phk_cauk1haaN1
\xe an openwork basket with tapering bottom woven with a design of big meshes, esp. used for carrying firewood
\pc1 1_phk_cauk1hAN1.jpg
\pc2 2_phk_cauk1hAN1.jpg
\xn

\rf

\xv cojetahMnYigq (mokq)
\xr cqi1 tq1 hAm1 naiN2 (mauk1)
\so phk_cqi1tq1haam1naiN2
\xe a kind of rosy colour flower, ( purpuria )

the ancestor spirit who look after
Tai Phake village and the Tai Phake people.
Ho Phi (hq6 phI6 (spirit house)
is usually located in the east of
the village in a forest preserve for.
 The Phakes
worship cau3 sz6 and 
observed two abstinenance
day every after eight days
called  <wan2 kam2 > in
honour of the deity. They
sincerely refrain from tilling
soiling , seedling paddy,
cutting tree, digging soil, and
avoiding making of high
decible sound in the morning
hours in these two days of  <
wan2kam2 > and offer oblation
or perform ritual twice in a
year which falls on the second
day of first wan2kam2 fall in the
month of  < nzn2 hok1 >,
and  <nzn2 sipsauN6 > also cau3 sz6 mzN2 loN6 phaa54 ke5

\dt 20/Apr/2023

\lx suM
\le
\ph sum1
\so phk_sum1
\ps n
\de "polo", a kind of traditional fish catching implement, it is a basket like fishing gear made of fully chopped bamboo. 
the gear has opening on the top and gradually widen to the broader base at the bottom. it is used in  shallow ponds, 
lake and flowing water. the base of the gear is inserted in to the mud of warer logged area and one can picked
 the trapped fish from the enclosed water area through the openning on the top  
\ge fish-trap
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv
\xr
\xe
\xn
\notes ailot

\lx sojyoj (emaxoM)
\le
\ph sqi1 yqi1 (mq6 khAm2)
\so phk_sqi1yqi1
\ps n.
\de a name of a Tai Phake traditional song, this type of song was performed by the boys and girls taking turns and
singing in response to each other. It was performed whilst pounding the rice. Older
villagers today say it was very popular around fifty years ago 
\ge name. Tai Phake traditional song
\pl
\pd
\pde  
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv emaxoMsojyoj
\xr mq6 khAm2 sqi1 yqi1
\so phk_mq6khaam2sqi1yqi1
\xe a < sqi1 yqi1 >song 
\xn

\xr mj5 tai2

\so phk_phan2tai2

\xr tai pha4 ke5 mzN2 a1 sam1
\so phk_tai2pha4ke5mzN2a1sam1
\xe The Tai Phakes  is a branch of
great Tai race and Buddhist
population of Assam, India
with its microscopic existence,
less than 2000 souls are mostly
dwelt in villages. The Tai
Phakes had migrated from
Moung Mao  of South China,
across Myanmar and then Pat
Kai Hills and finally entered
Assam through Pang Shau
Pass in 1775 AD and
embraces the Brahmaputra
valley as their home.

\lx nkq
\le nkq
\ph nak1
\so phk_nak1
\ps adj.
\de heavy, esp. used for thing, and applied to similar thing
\ge heavy
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv xnqnkq
\xr khan6 nak1
\so phk_khan6nak1
\xe high price, expensive; costly
\xv xjnkq
\xr khAi3 nak1
\so phk_khaai3nak1
\xe to seriously ill, ill is heavy
\xv xoMnkq
\xr khAm2 nak1
\so phk_khaam2nak1
\xe serious or important matter
\xv cEnkq
\xr cav2 nak1
\so phk_cav2nak1
\xe heart is heavy, great deal of sadness 
\xv supqnkq
\xr sop1 nak1
\so phk_sop1nak1
\xe slow in responding  lit. heavy mouth
\xv tinqnkq
\xr tin2 nak1
\so phk_tin2nak1
\xe leg feels heavy and slow
\xv tuwqnkq
\xr to2 nak1
\so phk_to2nak1
\xe heavy body, of comparatively great weight
\xv hpqnkq
\xr hAp1 nak1
\so phk_haap1nak1
\xe heavy load or (to be borne) heavy responsible
\xv huwqnkq
\xr ho6 nak1
\so phk_ho6nak1
\xe feeling unease, lit. head is heavy
\xv AamUnkq
\xr a1 mU2 nak1
\so phk_a1mU2nak1
\xe a work needing much physical or manual effort
\xv nkqcEnkqexa
\xr nak1 cav2 nak1 khq2
\so phk_nak1cav2nak1khq2
\xe to be very heavily burdened in mind, heavy hearted
\xv AnqnkqAnqmW  
\xr an2 nak1 an2 mau2
\so phk_an2nak1an2mau2   
\xe the heavy and the light one 

\xv tinqnkq
\xr tin2 nak1
\so phk_tin2nak1
\xe leg feels heavy, slow, inactive
\xv nkqcE
\xr nak1 cav2 
\so phk_nak1cav2
\xe in distress, in misery, and suffering, lit.is heavy  heart 
\xv huwqnkq
\xr ho6 nak1
\so phk_ho6nak1
\xe head is feeling heavy, feel heaviness in the head
\xv nkqcEnkqexa
\xr nak1 cav2 nak1 khq2
\so phk_nak1cav2nak1khq2
\xe to feeling very heavy hearted, one has a feeling of sadness , sorrow lit, heavy in
heart and throat
\xv cEnkq
\xr cav2 nak1
\so phk_cav2nak1
\xe heart is heavy, distress, great deal of sadness, miserable state
\xv nkDnogD
\xr nak1 nak2 nauN1 nauN1
\so phk_nak1nak2nauN1nauN1
\xe very heavy

\xn

\dt 22/Feb/2023

\lx nmq
\le nM
\ph nAm1
\so phk_naam1
\ps n'
\de the day of the week on which one is born. Each day is represented by an animal; 
as Sunday is Garuda, Monday-Tiger, Tuesday-Lion, Wednesday ( a. m ) - Elephant ( tame ), 
Wednesday ( p. m ) - a full grown or matured elephant without tusks, Thursday- Rat, Friday- goat,  Saturday - 
serpant. It is believed that one's birthday is suited to each other or not, esp. in marriage, because 
of the said animal. 
\ge birth-day
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv nmqpUkJnq
\xr nAm1 pU2 kvn2
\so phk_naam1pU2kvn2
\xe the animals of one's birthday is compatible or favourable to each other 
\xv nmqfkqkJnq
\xr nAm1 phAk4 kvn2
\so phk_naam1phaak4kvn2
\xe the animals of one's birthday is not compitable or unfavourable to each other 
\xn
\notes ailot
\dt 22/Feb/2023

\dt 28/Aug/2020

\lx nimq
\le
\ph nim3
\so phk_nim3
\ps clf.
\de a classifier for a handful bundle as of rice stalk (as much as one can grasp by
the hand) 
\ge CLF- bundle of rice stalk
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv nimqxWsipqnimq
\xr nim3 khau3 sip1 nim3
\so phk_nim3khau3sip1nim3
\xe ten handful bundle of rice stalk
\xn

\so phk_niu4khvN5kaaN2
\xe middle finger

\xr niu4 cI4
\so phk_niu4cI4
\xe the forefinger

\xr niu4 mj5
\so phk_niu4mj5

\xr niu4 No4 mj5
\so phk_niu4No4mj5

\so phk_niu4mj mV2

\xr niu4 qn1
\so phk_niu4qn1
\xe the little finger 
\xv niwqemtinq
\xr niu4 mj5 tin2
\so phk_niu4mj5tin2
\xe the toe thumb, lit. mother toe thumb

\lx nI

\ph nI2
\so phk_nI2

\dt 19/Oct/2023

\lx nukq
\le no ukq
\ph nok1
\so phk_nok1
\ps n.
\de (of mind, heart) deaf, stupid, stubborn
\ge deaf
\pl i
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv cEnukq
\xr cav2 nok1
\so phk_cav2nok1
\xe unwise, stupid, lit. deaf heart
\xv kunqcEnukq
\xr kon2 cav2 nok1
\so phk_kon2cav2nok1
\xe an unwise or stupid person  a deaf hearted person, 
\xv sinqcEnukq
\xr sEn3 cav2 nok1
\so phk_sEn3cav2nok1
\xe unwise, stupid, a deaf hearted
\xv hUno ukqtamotq
\xr hU6 nok1 tA2 mqt1
\so phk_hU6nok1taa2mqt1
\xe unlearned, ignorant, illiterate, lit. deaf and blind
\xv tgqnjkiNqcWkYotqepsinqcEnukqligqsE
\xr tvN2 nai4 kjn1 cau3 kyaut3 pj4 sen3 cav2 nok1 laiN2 sav6
\so phk_tvN2nai4kjn1cau3kyaut3pj4sen3cav2nok1laiN2sav6
\xe Then, the Lord can preach to those deaf hearts so that they are bright and clear.'

\dn

\so phk_sU6thqm1nam4waa5kau2Nin2
\xe you should all to listen to the words that I speak
\xn

\dt 02/Mar/2024

\rf

\so phk_nvN1kau1

\xv nJgqnj  
\xr nvN1 nai4
\so phk_nvN1nai4
\xe l thus, ike this, of this kind, and so, in this manner or way, 
\xv nJgqnnq   
\xr nvN1 nan4  
\so phk_nvN1nan4  
\xe like that
\xv nJgqkJnq
\xr nvN1 kvn2 
\so phk_nvN1kvn2
\xe it seems

\so phk_tai2nvN1kvn2
\xe it seems that he is a Tai man

\xe as one wish, as desired, as one's liking

\xr mA5 nvN1 cav2
\so phk_maa5nvN1kvn2
\xe not as one wishes or expect

\so phk_tj4 nvN1waa5

\so phk_nvN1ta1taai6
\xe like will die

\xr nvN1 tj4

\xr nvN1 wA5

\le
\ph pa1
\so phk_pa1
\ps n
\de particle prefixed to the names of fish, mostly to the monosyllabic names.

\pdn

\so phk_paa2pa1khau6

\so phk_pho1taa1 
\ps n.

\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv fuwqtawigqxM

\ge drais off

\dn
\rf

\xr mA1 nam2 nA2
\so phk_maa1nam2naa2

\xn
\notes ailot

\notes ailot
\dt 04/Mar/2023

\lx ma
\le
\ph ma1
\so phk_ma1
\ps n
\de a particle denoting fruits, used as the prefix to the names 
of some kind of fruits, or the similar thing, as well as <banchob mAk1>
a corrupted form of < mAk1 > 
\ge PREFIX.-fruits
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv maktq
\xr ma1 kAt4
\so phk_ma1 kaat4
\xe a kind of thorny creeper plant and its fragrant seed; like black pepper, 
used as spice (Zanthoxylum alatum )
\xv maktqvJnq (nMhoM)
\xr ma1 kAt4 thzn1 (nAm6 hqm6)
\so phk_ma1kaat4thzn1 
\xe a kind of thorny creeper having medicinal value, ( Zanthoxylum  hamiltonianum ) see naam6hqm6
\xv makalkq
\xr ma1 ka1 lak1
\so phk_ma1ka1lak1
\xe a quince, a bael, (Aegle marmelos) 
\xv makigq
\xr ma1 keN6
\so phk_ma1keN6
\xe a kind wild fruits used as comb for brushing thread
\xv makugq
\xr ma1 koN4 
\so phk_ma1koN4 
\xe a castor tree and its fruit(see maak1koN5 )
\xv makugqfJkq

\so phk_ma1koN4phzk1

\so phk_ma1kauk1
\xe hog's plum see < maak1kauk1 >

\notes ailot
\dt 04/Jun/2023

\lx ma
\le
\ph mA3
\so phk_maa3
\ps v
\de to toss, to agitate, to wriggle, writhe, frenzy
\ge toss
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf 


\xv mamI
\xr mA3 mI3
\so phk_maa3mI3
\xe to be violently agitated  
\xv mamImafgq
\xr mA3 mI3 mA3 phAN2
\so phk_maa3mI3maa3phaaN2
\xe frenziedly, behave in a frenzied or wildly excited 
\xv nonqma
\xr nqn2 mA3
\so phk_nqn2maa3
\xe (esp. of baby or infant) restlessness during a night of sleep, the body is not
completely still during sleep   
\xv nonqma
\xr nqn6 mA3
\so phk_nqn6maa3
\xe maggots are wriggling
\xv mamutq
\xr mA3 mot4
\so phk_maa3mot4
\xe behave in a frenzied way
\xv cipqfYiwqma
\xr cep1 phju6 mA3
\so phk_cep1phju6maa3
\xe twist and squirm or rolling here and there with pain
\xv malaAa
\xr mA3 la3 A1
\so phk_maa3la3aa1
\xe to agitate as a mad man
\xv kunqmatatj
\xr kon2 mA3 ta1 tAi6
\so phk_kon2maa3ta1taai6
\xe a dying man is tossing his body
\xv mafImutq
\xr mA3 phI6 mot4
\so phk_maa3phI6mot4
\xe to possessed by spirit after reciting the incantation
\xv cEnJtqmavM#
\xr cav2 nvt1 mA3 tham4 tham4
\so phk_cav2nvt1maa3tham4tham4
\xe to get so much angry and violently agitated 
\xv maahJnD
\xr mA3 mA3 hvn2 hvn2
\so phk_maa3maa3hvn2hvn2
\xe frenziedly
\xn

\dt 07/Feb/2022

\xn
\notes ailot
\dt 12/Feb/2024

\lx ma
\le
\ph mA3
\so phk_maa3
\ps v.
\de to struggle, to try hard or make great efforts to do something
\ge struggle
\pl

\ps n
\de a cloud
\ge cloud
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv mokqfa
\xr mauk1 phA4
\so phk_mauk1phaa4
\xe a cloud 
\xv mokqfunq
\xr mauk1 phon6
\so phk_mauk1phon6
\xe the rain cloud
\xv mokqfJkq
\xr mauk1 phzk1
\so phk_mauk1phzk1
\xe the cumulus cloud in the sky
\xv mokqmuNq
\xr mauk1 moi6
\so phk_mauk1moi6
\xe it is snowy, snow cloud
\xv mokqAJmq
\xr mauk1 zm3
\so phk_mauk1zm3
\xe it is foggy
\xn
\notes ailot

\ph mauN2
\so phk_mauN2
\ps n.
\de a kind of big, long drag net
\ge drag net
\pc1 1_phk_mauN2.jpg
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv kgqmogq   
\xr kAN2 mauN2
\so phk_kaaN2mauN2
\xe to lay the drag net in the river or sea for trapping fish  
\xv lkqmogq
\xr lAk4 mauN2
\so phk_laak4mauN2
\xe to draw the lay drag net  from water
\xn
\notes ailot
\dt 30/Apr/2021

\xe Diospyros lanceifolia is a tree in the Ebenaceae family. It grows up to
 27 metres (90 ft) tall. Twigs are reddish brown when young, aging blackish 
or dark brown. Inflorescences bear up to 10 flowers. The fruits are round, up to 
2.5 cm (1 in) in diameter.

\dt 25/May/2020

\lx ynqes
\le
\ph yAn1 sj6
\so phk_yaan1sj6

\ge off.and.on

\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv mJnqynqesma
\xr mvn2 yAn1 sj6 mA2
\so phk_mvn2yaan1sj6maa2
\xe he comes off and on 
\xv ynqesynqes
\xr yAn1 sj6 An1 sj6
\so phk_yaan1sj6yaan1sj6
\xe off.and.on, often, intermittently, occasionally, sporadically, at irregular intervals

\lx lkqnI  (cJwqwnqcJwqpIlkqnIpItj)
\le
\ph cv5 wan2 cv5 pI2 lak1 nI3 pI2 tai2
\so phk_cv5wan2cv5pI2lak1nI3pI2tai2 
\ps n.

\ge Phake < lak1 nI3 > system

\so phk_nap1pau3 
\xe the name of second (2)year of the Lakni (sexagenary cycle)

\so phk_haai2NyI3

\notes
\dt 13/Mar/2023

\lx lkqnI  (cJwqempIlkqnI)
\le
\ph cv5 mj5 pI2 lak1 nI3
\so phk_cv5mj5pI2lak1nI3
\ps n.
\de the name of decimal series of sexagenal cycle (the sixty days and sixty years cycle calenderical system )
 of the ancient Tai as Phake < lak1 nI3 >, lit. the name of the mothers of < lak1 nI3 > days of cycle
\ge name of decimal series of sexagenal cycle 
\pl kpq
\xr kap1
\so phk_kap1
\xe the name of first day of the ten days circle of <mj5 pI2> mother year
\pl npq
\xr nap1
\so phk_nap1
\xe the name of second day of the ten days circle of mj5 pI2 mother year
\pl hj
\xr hAi2 
\so phk_haai2
\xe the name of third day of the ten days circle of mj5 pI2 mother year
\pl mJgq
\xr mzN2
\so phk_mzN2
\xe the name of fourth day of the ten days circle of mj5 pI2 mother year
\pl pJkq
\xr pzk1
\so phk_pzk1
\xe the name of fifth day of the ten days circle of mj5 pI2 mother year
\pl ktq
\xr kat1
\so phk_ kat1
\xe the name of sixth day of the ten days circle of mj5 pI2 mother year
\pl xutq
\xr khot1
\so phk_khot1
\xe the name of seventh day of the ten days circle of mj5 pI2 mother year
\pl hugq
\xr huN6
\so phk_huN6
\xe the name of eighth day of the ten days circle of mj5 pI2 mother year
\pl tW
\xr tau3
\so phk_tau3   
\xe the name of ninth day of the ten days circle of mj5 pI2 mother year
\pl ka
\xr kA1
\so phk_kaa1   
\xe the name of tenth day of the ten days circle of mj5pI2 (mother year)
\notes
\dt 13/Mar/2023

\lx lkqnI, cJwqwnq
\le
\ph wan2
\so phk_wan2
\ps prefix
\de prefix name of the day of (khop1) ten days cycle and <wan2pzk1   wan2kat1>
is <wan2 kam observe day according <lak1 nI3>
\ge PREFIX
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv 1.wnqkpq 
\xr wan2 kap1
\sn phk_wan2kap1
\xe the name of the first day
\xv 2.wnqnpq 
\xr wan2 nap1
\so phk_wan2nap1
\xe the name of the second day
\xv 3.wnqhj
\xr wan2hAi2
\so phk_wan2haai2
\xe the name of the third day
\xv 4.wnqmJgq
\xr wan2mzN2
\so phk_wan 2mzN2
\xe the name of the of the fourth day
\xv 5.wnqpJkq 
\xr wan2 pzk1
\so phk_wan2pzk1
\xe the name of the fifth day
\xv 6.wnqktq
\xr wan2 kat1
\so phk_wan2kat1
\xe the name of the sixth day
\xv 7.wnqxutq 
\xr wan2khot1
\so phk_wan2khot1  
\xe the name of the seveth day
\xv 8.wnqhugq
\xr wan2huN6
\so phk_wan2 huN6
\xe the name of the eighth day
\xv 9. wnqtW 
\xr wan2tau
\so phk_wan2 tau3
\xe the name of the ninth day
\xv 10. wnqka
\xr  wan2 kA1
\so phk_ wan2kaa1
\xe the name of the tenth day
\pde the name of days of  cycle ten days cycle and <wan2pzk1   wan2kat1> is
<wan2 kam2>

\lx wnq
\le
\ph wAn1
\so phk_waan1
\ps n
\de a bowl, dish
\ge bowl
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv wnqfkq
\xr wAn1 phak1
\so phk_waan1phak1
\xe curry bowl
\xv wnqex
\xr wan1 khj1
\so phk_wan1khj1
\xe china clay bowl, porcelin bowl
\xv wnqtogq
\xr wAn1 tauN2
\so phk_waan1tauN2
\xe a brass bowl
\xv wnqemq
\xr wAn1 mE3
\so phk_waan1mE3
\xe porcelain bowl
\xv wnqxj
\xr wAn1 khai1
\so phk_waan1khai1
\xe egg bowl, offering of < waan1 khai1 >  by the bride groom family to the head of the family of bride at the time of ritual of the wedding 
ceremony is a customary system of Tai Phake and hence is inevitable. Its content 4 unboiled eggs in one bowl
and 4 or more unboiled eggs in another bowl covered with fine cloth. the unboil egg bowl is for 
offering to house spirits and the unboiled is for distribution to the close relatives
\xn
\notes ailot

\lx hogq
\le
\ph hauN2
\so phk_hauN2
\ps v
\de to receive, to carry or hold the things with two hands open and close together
or held in container
\ge receive.with.both.hands
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf
\xv xYkq nj hogq mJwq tJwq yukq tgq nM guNq mnq nM pJnq hE xJgq lU tgq tnq
\xr ==khyAk4 nai4  hauN2  mV2  tV2  yok4  tAN1 nvm2 Noi1 mAn1 nam4
pzn5 hav3 khvN5 lU1 tAN2 tAn2
\so phk_khyaak4nai4hauN2mV2tV2
yok4taaN1nvm2Noi1maan1nam4pzn5hav3khvN5lU1taaN2taan2
\xe And now, holding it in cupped hands, raising in up the pure money and donation is presented and offered
\xn

\ps n.
\de one, (in Tai Phake "et1" used only in sip et1 (eleven) and saau2 et1 (twenty one) for all the rest nvN5 is used)  
\ge one
\pl
\pd
\pde
\pdn
\dn
\rf 


\xv sipqAitq
\xr sip1 et1
\so phk_sip1et1
\xe eleven
\xv sWAitq
\xr sau2 et1
\so phk_sau2 et1  
\xe twenty one
\xv pkqAitq
\xr pAk1 et1
\so phk_paak1et
\xe one hundred and one
\xv nJnqsipqAitq
\xr nzn2 sip1 et1
\so phk_nzn2sip1et1
\xe the eleventh month of the Tai calender year
\xn
\notes ailot

\so phk_tQ1maak1ma1hqp3
